questiontext.text: Young men in a population have an average height of 170 cm and a standard deviation of 6.75 cm. Young women have a mean height of 160 cm and a standard deviation of 6.25 cm. Both distributions are approximately normal. A young man and a young woman are chosen at random. Which answer describes the sample distribution the difference in height between the chosen man and the chosen woman?

answer.text: This sample distribution is a normal distribution with a mean of 10 and a standard error of 0.50.

feedback.text: This sample distribution is a normal distribution with a mean of 10 and a standard error of 0.50: Incorrect

answer.text: This sample distribution is a normal distribution with a mean of 10 and a standard error of 9.20.

feedback.text: This sample distribution is a normal distribution with a mean of 10 and a standard error of 9.20: Correct

answer.text: This sample distribution is a normal distribution with a mean of 165 and a standard error of 13.

feedback.text: This sample distribution is a normal distribution with a mean of 165 and a standard error of 13: Incorrect

answer.text: This sample distribution is a normal distribution with a mean of 101.9 and a standard error of 13.

feedback.text: This sample distribution is a normal distribution with a mean of 101.9 and a standard error of 13: Incorrect
